moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4 3. Nf3 g5 4. h4 g4 5: The games all start here. It didn't really help my playing that I would never ever play an opening like this, it's just too risky.
moves.6... Kxf7 7. Bc4+: This is the second most popular move, the most popular is Qxg4.
moves.7... d5: I've had bad experiences with just about everything else in this mini tournament, the only thing I haven't tried is this.
moves.8. Bxd5+ Be6 9. Bxe6+ Kxe6: My king is lured out into the big wide world.
moves.10. Qxg4+: Uh-oh, I knew this was coming. The good news for me is that his LSB is gone, I've had major problems in other games with people using the LSB and the queen to attack my king's knight twice.
moves.10... Kf7 11. Qxf4+: His queens wipes away some more pawns
moves.11... Qf6 12. Qxc7+: Gobble gobble gobble, his queen greedily eats pawn after pawn.
moves.12... Qe7: If I played Be7, he could pin my queen to my king with O-O.
moves.13... Nf6 14. Qf4: I start to think that playing Ke8 would have been the better choice.
moves.15. e5: But this is really painful, there's no way I can stop him from stealing my knight.
moves.15... h5: Thinking about getting my rook active.
moves.16. exf6 Bxf6: If I captured with my queen he could have moved his queen and pinned mine with his rook.
moves.17. Nc3 Rg8: Looking for a way to counterattack.
moves.18... Qc5+ 19. d4 Qxd5: I take his knight, but he can take my bishop
moves.24... Kc6 25. Rf6+: And brings his last piece into the battle. Just look at this position. He has all of his pieces attacking me, and the only piece I really have defending is my queen.
moves.26... Qxc4: I thought the queen capture was better than the king, but if someone else doesn't think so, please drop a comment.
moves.28... Ka4: Two... My king is shoved to the block...
moves.30. Qxa6#: ...And he lops off my king's head. Oh well, at least I lasted thirty moves, unlike last game were I was decimated in 17.

gameName: Walking the Walk & Learning to Run Welcome MT Pt 9
